feed.title: RTA Live Traffic - Regional NSW South
feed.subtitle: This traffic region is bounded by the South Australian border and Wentworth in the west to Bega and Batemans Bay in the east. The region extends as for south as Deniliquin and the Victorian border and as far north as Helensburgh and Abercrombie. The region includes the towns of Griffith, Young and Wollongong. There are currently 28 hazards in this region.
feed.rights: Copyright: Roads and Traffic Authority (NSW); Licence: http://livetraffic.rta.nsw.gov.au/#dev

entry.title: HAZARD Roadway blocked - BEMBOKA Snowy Mountains Hwy on Brown Mountain
entry.content:
Regional NSW - South
Bemboka Snowy Mountains Hwy on Brown Mountain
HAZARD - Mudslide
Started 01/03/2012 4:56pm, last checked today 4:36pm
Impact: Highway closed in both directions.
Attending:RTA
RTA Advice:Avoid the area
Other Advice:The Brown Mountain, on the Snowy Mountains Highway between Bega and Cooma, is closed to all traffic until further notice.

The alternative route for light vehicles is via Mount Darragh Road between Pambula and Bombala. This detour is limited to vehicles less than 42.5 tonnes and 19m in length.

Restricted Access Vehicles (25m B-Doubles) can only use the Monaro Highway via Victoria (check current Victorian conditions).

4.6m High Vehicles can use Clyde Mountain, Monaro or Princes Highway only.

Note: load limit on Coolumbooka Bridge at Bombala is 42.5t.
Location:View on map

entry.title: FLOODING - IRRIGATION WAY Narrandera to Leeton
entry.content:
Regional NSW - South
Irrigation Way Narrandera to Leeton
FLOODING - Open with alternating traffic
Started 15/03/2012 8:13am, last checked today 1:32pm
Impact: Traffic affected in both directions.
RTA Advice:Exercise caution
Allow extra travel time
Other Advice:The road is open to ALL traffic between Narrandera and Leeton. There is water over road 5kms north east of Narrandera Airport. Traffic Controllers and portable traffic signals in place. One lane in operation.

entry.title: FLOODING - SNOWY RIVER SHIRE COUNCIL AREA Various Roads
entry.content:
Regional NSW - South
Snowy River Shire Council Area Various Roads
FLOODING
Started 01/03/2012 1:56pm, last checked today 1:02pm
Website:Snowy River Shire Council
Attending:Local council
Other Advice:As at Monday 19 March at 1pm, the council advises that the following roads are closed due to flooding:

Yaouk Road - 4WD vehicles, residents only
Wainui Road - 4WD vehicles, residents only
Dry Plains Road - 4WD vehicles only
Rockwell Road - closed at Dalgety end - Detour via Bulgundara Road
Geikle Creek Road closed- residents only from Jindabyne end
Barry Way - unsealed section closed
Brooks Road - closed from Kosciuszko Road to causeway
Bobundara Road - closed at bridge (severely damaged)
Coolamatong Road - closed
Big Yard Road - 4WD vehilces residents only

Snowy River Shire Council are currently assessing the condition of all roads throughout the shire. Temporary repairs, where possible, will be carried out to make roads passable. However permanent repair will take sometime and residents should be aware that problems are expected to remain for a considerable amount of time.

For more information please see the council website.
Location:View on map

entry.title: FLOODING - KIDMAN WAY Waddi (Darlington Point) to Coleambally
entry.content:
Regional NSW - South
Kidman Way Waddi (Darlington Point) to Coleambally
FLOODING
Started 16/03/2012 6:22pm, last checked today 11:46am
Impact: Highway closed in both directions.
Attending:RTA
RTA Advice:Avoid the area
Use alternative route
Other Advice:There is water over road 5kms south of Waddi.
Traffic is being diverted north of Jerilderie.
Local traffic access ONLY permitted from north of Jerilderie to Coleambally.
Northbound diversion: from 16kms north of Jerilderie - detour via Newell Highway to Jerilderie, Conargo Road to Conargo and Deniliquin, Cobb Highway to Hay, Mid Western Highway to Goolgowi and Kidman Way to Griffith.
There is NO ACCESS Southbound from Waddi.
Darlington Point and Waddi are isolated due to flood waters.
Kidman Way is open to all vehicles between Griffith and Darlington Point.
Location:View on map

entry.title: CHANGED TRAFFIC CONDITIONS - COOMA-MONARO AND BEGA DISTRICT Various Roads
entry.content:
Regional NSW - South
Cooma-Monaro and Bega District Various Roads
CHANGED TRAFFIC CONDITIONS - Oversize and Overmass Vehicle Restrictions Except Agricultural Vehicles
Started 05/03/2012 10:26am, last checked 09/03/2012 3:06pm
Other Advice:Due to excessive rainfall:
Loads exceeding 3.5 metres wide are not to travel until further notice on and west of the Monaro Highway, including the Snowy Mountains Highway, Kosciuszko Road and Jindabyne Road.

Loads exceeding 80 Tonnes Gross Mass are not to travel until further notice on the Princes Highway and on or west of the Monaro Highway, including the Snowy Mountains Highway, Kosciuszko Road and Jindabyne Road
Location:View on map
